chapter.title: Menu
chapter.para: OmegaT has very few buttons and looks a bit stern, if not outright unfriendly, to people who are used to button-based interfaces. Most of the action takes place with the help of shortcuts associated to menu items.
Shortcuts are ubiquitous in this manual and you should be able very shortly to remember the few that are useful in the course of a standard translation day.
Menus are where you access most of OmegaT's functions. Most menu items have an associated keyboard shortcut.
Menu items that do not indicate a shortcut do not have one assigned by default. See the appendix if you want to modify or add shortcuts.
